channel.title: Character Saving
channel.description:
Ok, well basically i want to change where my character file saves and loads i found the current spot
[code]"./Characters/"[/code]
I want it to save to
Using Below As An Example.
[code]C:\.ds_store\modelData[/code]
If i were to do that i would get this error...
[code]client.java:6762: illegal escape character characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("C:\.d s_store\modelData"+ playerName + ".txt")); ^ client.java:6762: illegal escape character characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("C:\.d s_store\modelData"+ playerName + ".txt"));
^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
So..? Any Help?

item.title: Character Saving
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("C:/.ds_store/modelData"+ playerName + ".txt"));
Razr`:

\ is used for special characters so you have to use / or put \.

Read full topic

item.title: Character Saving
item.dc:creator: @Razr1 Razr`
item.description:
@Razr1 wrote:

\ is used for special characters so you have to use / or put \.

item.title: Character Saving
item.dc:creator: @_mpire £mpire
item.description:
@_mpire wrote:

How about this…

[code]client.java:6762: illegal escape character
characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(“C:.d
s_store\Characters”+ playerName + “.txt”));
^
client.java:6762: illegal escape character
characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(“C:.d
s_store\Characters”+ playerName + “.txt”));

    ^

2 errors
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

Read full topic
